content.description:
This undocumented sport route starts on the far right side of the main buttress. There are multiple cruxes as you approach the final roof. You can pull the roof directly and head up to some anchors to the right. Another option, if lichenous roofs aren't your thing, is to traverse left and head to the anchors on

Stanley's Steamer

. A small cam is suggested for this option.
content.protection: Bolts and an optional green C3 if you go to the anchors on the left.
content.location: This the rightmost bolted line on the main buttress.

content.description:
This has a crux down low, but it is sustained to the anchors. It has great rock and climbing.

P1) 5.12c/d. Follow bolts up and left passing a low crux. Turn the roof, and continue to a bolted anchor.
content.protection: 6 bolts, a 1.5 inch cam, and a medium stopper.
content.location: Climb the face up to the roof right of the cracks and dihedrals on the left side of the Lion's Den.

content.description:
This is power crack climbing and liebacking followed by a nice face. It is one of the best routes at the Palace.

P1) 5.11c Start as for

Golden Harvest

, then angle right into a lieback feature (a #4 Camalot is handy), continue angling up and right following the weakness to a ledge. Move right, and follow bolts up the face to bolted anchors.
content.protection: TCUs to a #4 Camalot and bolts. A few medium stoppers are handy. Bring lots of long slings.
content.location:
This is just right of

Golden Harvest

.

content.description:
This is an obvious crack line just left of

Pug's Den

(first bolted route on the Lion's Den). Climb past a couple of small ledges to gain the crack. Crank a few steep moves up and over to stellar moderate ground in the corner above. It is a great warm-up route with excellent moderate climbing.
content.protection: A set of cams from small to 2 inches and a nuts.
content.location: This is the first route you come to at the Lion's Den.

content.description: Ascend a sharp finger crack to join 2 bolts on interesting holds.  A #3 Camalot and finger-sized cams protect the crux moves to the anchor.
content.location: It is the first route on the left on the smaller formation to the right of the main wall.

content.description: This is an adventurous sport route with two distinct cruxes - one above the fourth bolt and another traversing left along a hand-rail above the sixth bolt. Once you pull around the overhang and gain the arete, head straight up on more good stone to gain the chains.
content.location: This is the first bolted route at the Lion's Den.

climbs.name: Harvest Moon
climbs.fa: Steve McCorkel, Kurt Stroble, Matt Flach, Jan. '12

content.description:
This is the 100th route added to the Palace on MP.com.

Start right of Sunday's Child (the obvious bolted face in the middle of the crag). Begin with a crux (we pre-placed a nut with a stick); continue up, then go slightly right on a ledge, then go up again to the anchors on top, shared with

Golden Harvest

.
content.protection: Rack from about 3/4 inch pieces to a very handy #3 Camalot.
content.location:
This starts right of Sunday's Child and finishes at the anchor for

Golden Harvest

.

content.description: After a little Autumn harvest, this crack is now pretty obvious. Bust straight up the right and then left-facing feature to the 4 inch crack. Continue with some very nice jamming to the top of the buttress.
content.protection: Rack up to a #2 Camalot, with a #5, medium-sized wires, small and medium TCUs; a #0 Metolius works nicely. There is a 2-bolt anchor on top.
content.location: It is in the middle of the buttress, just right of the large, rocky ledge.

content.description: This is a fun, though-provoking route with hard moves right off the ground. Pull off the ground and fire a left hand up to an obvious undercling - bulge. Enjoy thin balance climbing climbing to a strange and very physical crux move past the fourth bolt.
content.protection: Draws and possibly a small or medium-sized cam to protect the easy runout above. A runner is nice for the second bolt.
content.location: This is the last route with bolts on the wall.

content.description:
This line doesn't look like much from below, but it has some excellent climbing. Start just right of the first bolted line on the left side of the buttress.  Follow a lieback flake and jog back and forth until reaching a grungy V-slot.  Place some good gear and traverse right under the overhang with lots of air below you.  A key red Alien can be placed on the way to the anchors of

Sunday's Child

.
content.protection: 1 set to #4, extra small and medium cams.
content.location:
It is just to the right of

Pug's Den

.

content.description:
This is an excellent little adventure up the right-leaning crack / flake system on the little face to the right of

Bodies Like Sheep

. Move right into the Lumpyesque lieback crack near the top (crux).
content.protection: Cams from small to 2 inches, and nuts.
content.location:
This is the obvious, right-leaning, crack/flake system just right of

Bodies Like Sheep

. It is the last route on the wall.
